taxon_name.authority: (H. M. Hall ex D. D. Keck) B. G. Baldwin

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe madiinae;genus deinandra;species increscens;subspecies increscens

bio:treatment.description: Stems usually erect, sparsely to densely leafy. Heads in open, paniculiform arrays. Ray florets 8–13(–15). Disc florets 11–32. 2n = 24.
Grass-lands, openings in woodlands, chaparral, and coastal scrub, disturbed sites (e.g., roadsides, fallow fields), often sandy or clayey soils, sometimes serpentine;
bio:treatment.discussion: Subspecies increscens occurs in foothills and valleys of the South Coast Ranges, on the immediate Central Coast and northern South Coast, and on Santa Rosa Island.
